009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class implements the CIELuv color space. See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for
018 * additional details. All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
019 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
020 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile connection
021 * space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ coordinates
022 * in Java's profile connection space. This is a singleton class with no public
023 * constructors, use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
027 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
028 * </p>
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2022/09/01
032 */
033@SuppressWarnings("serial")
034public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
035        private static final sRgbColorSpace srgbCS = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
036        private static final LuvColorSpace instance = new LuvColorSpace();
037        
038        public static LuvColorSpace getInstance() {
039                return instance;
040        }
041                
042        // D65 reference white point:
043        private static final double[] XYZref = StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ();
044        private static final double uuref = fu(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // u'_n
045        private static final double vvref = fv(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // v'_n
046        
047        // chromatic adaptation objects:
048        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D65, StandardIlluminant.D50);
049        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(StandardIlluminant.D50, StandardIlluminant.D65);
050        
051        /** Constructor (non-public). */
052        private LuvColorSpace() {
053                super(TYPE_Luv,3);
054        }
055        
056        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
057        @Override
058        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
059                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
060                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
061        }
062        
063        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
064        @Override
065        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {    
066                double X = XYZ65[0];
067                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
068                double Z = XYZ65[2];
069                double YY = f1(Y / XYZref[1]);          // Y'
070                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
071                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
072                double L = (116.0 * YY - 16.0);                 //L*
073                double u = (13 * L * (uu - uuref));     //u*
074                double v = (13 * L * (vv - vvref));     //v*
075                return new float[] {(float)L, (float)u, (float)v};
076        }
077        
078        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
079        @Override
080        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
081                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
082                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
083        }
084        
085        // CIELab->XYZ65
086        @Override
087        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
088                double L = Luv[0];
089                double u = Luv[1];
090                double v = Luv[2];
091                double Y = XYZref[1] * f2((L + 16) / 116.0);
092                double uu = (L < 0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
093                double vv = (L < 0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
094                double X = Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv));
095                double Z = Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv));
096                return new float[] {(float)X, (float)Y, (float)Z};
097        }
098        
099        //sRGB -> CIELuv
100        @Override
101        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
102                float[] XYZ65 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ65(srgb);
103                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
104        }
105        
106        //CIELuv -> sRGB
107        @Override
108        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
109                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
110                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
111                return srgb;
112        }
113        
114        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
115        
116        private static final double Epsilon = 216.0/24389;
117        private static final double Kappa = 841.0/108;
118        
119        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
120        private double f1 (double c) {
121                return (c > Epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (Kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
122        }
123        
124        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
125        private double f2 (double c) {
126                final double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
127                return (c3 > Epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / Kappa;
128        }
129        
130        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
131                // fails if 0.001 is used!
132                return (X < 0.00001) ? 0 : (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
133        }
134        
135        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
136                return (Y < 0.00001) ? 0 : (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
137        }
138
139}
